news.title: Irish consumers warned to ‘brace themselves’ for ‘relentless’ health insurance hikes
news.summary: A new raft of health insurance price hikes and benefit reductions are being pushed through, it has emerged.

news.title: Young Irish father dies after being struck by car in US
news.summary: A young Irishman has been killed in the US.

news.title: Europe’s heatwave could spread to Ireland as early as this week
news.summary: As much of Europe bakes under a heat dome and tourists are warned about the dangers of high temperatures, Ireland could be in line for its own heatwave this week.

news.title: Fionnán Sheahan: Chasing that Mary Robinson moment – the presidential race gives Sinn Féin a shot to get its mojo back
news.summary: The elephant in the room of Sinn Féin’s call for voting rights in presidential elections to be extended to the diaspora is the 211,000 party voters in Northern Ireland. Sinn Féin claims “the president of Ireland is the president of all of Ireland”. Well, not really.

news.title: Homecoming for Mack Hansen off the bench as  eight Irish Lions start for Test dress rehearsal against Brumbies
news.summary: With less than two weeks to go until the first Test between the Lions and Australia in Brisbane, Andy Farrell has given the strongest indication yet of how he is viewing selection by naming a strong side to face the Brumbies on Wednesday.

news.title: Eavan Murray: Even sunscreen and the kids’ long-sleeved swimsuits are struggling in 32C Gran Canaria heat
news.summary: I felt a bit of a fraud as I began writing this article, because as we started our holiday, the heat had been manageable.

news.title: Eamonn Sweeney: Net gains by Cork and Tipp are showing a new way forward for the game of hurling
news.summary: Goodbye taking your points, hello going for goals. One point good, three points better. Much better.

news.title: Michael Houghton: Five easy, everyday habits that helped me move towards financial independence
news.summary: We often associate wealth with what we see – flashy cars, big houses, luxury holidays. But the truth is, real wealth is often invisible. It’s less about what you buy and more about the life you can build when money no longer controls you.

news.title: Ask Allison: My friend is great one on one but takes over completely in group conversations. How do I address this?
news.summary: In a group she completely dominates the conversation, no matter what it is about. She will talk about her holidays, her job, her kids, her hobbies – and no one ever gets a word in. No matter how little skin she has in the game.

news.title: Ciara Kelly: I love New York, but on my recent trip it seemed rundown, extremely divided and sad, like a dream dying
news.summary: New York is one of my favourite places on earth. One of my few regrets in life that I’ve never lived there. Never say never though.
